Reviews.Title: “Staff couldn't care at all!!!”
Reviews.Author: John L
Reviews.Content: Nobody on this staff can give good service and nobody cares about it! TWO Days in a row the restaurant made the SAME MISTAKE on my food order (a club sandwich WITHOUT lettuce or Tomatoes) and BOTH times (room service and in the restaurant) they left it on. After filling out the comment card, the front desk called to find to find out what was wrong (which would have increased this review score, if not for what came next) and said they'd call me back. THEY NEVER DID!!! AN HOUR later, someone came up with a fruit tray that I NEVER ORDERED. I explained to him that the front desk needs to call me about the restaurant AND that the A/C has been broken for 2 days (had already complained about this, but no use there either). An hour later, I call down AGAIN and they never got the message from the fruit tray person. Eventually they sent maintenance up again to look at the A/C, he said that to get it below 25C in the room, you have to set the "cool to" temp to 13C (and not the 20C I was aiming for). But it spent my first day in the room set at 13C and it made no difference, the room was still heated instead of cooled. I realize that I'm in a hotel in Mexico, but when a guest is complaining in English, it is not a sign of good customer service to not at least send someone along who speaks English so that the person on staff can communicate with the guest. Combined with the rest of the reasons I REALLY dislike this hotel, I'd not stick around the rest of the week if it weren't right across the street from where I needed to be. :( The local people from work advised me to not go outside after dark, and the hotel staff didn't disagree with that assessment. MAJOR THUMBS DOWN!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Radisson I've been in (so far...)”
Reviews.Author: noguchif
Reviews.Content: This is a decadent hotel, used to be called "Flamingo's" and Radisson took over it some time ago. Very bad service, uncomfortable room in some respects (pillows, to mention one) and located away from everything. The only "plus" sign (as you won't allow zero stars) is price. But, literally, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms in a Modern Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TonyCardenas
Reviews.Content: this is mostly a business hotel located in one of the most unatractive zones of Mexico city, but me and my family use it as an option for airport hotel , even its not that close to the international aiport its only a few minutes away and very well comunicated via high ways to both terminals and its rooms areussually much nicer and half the price of any of the aiport hotels . we ordered rooms service and food was nice , bell personnel was attentive and warm , reception personnel was not very well trained and quite unfriendly . they have a spa , restaurant , and business centeral very nice and modern , parking underground was abailable and safe . i recomend this hotel if you have business to do in the south side of the city , and for aiport lay overs that arrive late at night or in week ends when traffic is fluid , our ride was about 15 min .

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: ady348
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good value for money, i would not highly recommend on the location of this hotel. I like the in room service, zym and food in the hotel. I love to order in-room dining during my stay and believe me there were many options to feed one's hunger. One low point is the wodden door between two rooms. You can hear every noise coming out of next door also in the corridoor i heard lots of noises. Another low point was the shower it was really bad, you need to wait almost 10 minutes to adjust the water either its too cold or too hot. I felt that one day i may burn up my skin.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely superb!”
Reviews.Author: feltisjs
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. Though a little distance from the main attractions, it offers comfort, security and service of much higher rated hotels. The staff is highly friendly with the majority quite. competent in speaking English. I throughly enjoyed my stay at this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, so so location”
Reviews.Author: smluke
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean and tidy. The staff was friendly. The only complaints I have are : 1. The shower was really bad. Those water savers really don't give any pressure at all. 2. The location was not that great. Far from all the action. NOwhere to eat without grabbing a taxi or hoping on the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Give it a miss !”
Reviews.Author: archibalda
Reviews.Content: The only reason we stayed here in the first place was because of proximity to an event that we attended, but after 20 minutes to check in, a sad, gloomy and shabby room that although not actually dirty, gave the impression of being so, a washbasin with barely a trickle and a shower that was temperamental bouncing between scalding and freezing, a screw up by the concierge with a taxi order that made us half an hour late for our event and luke warm room-service dinner. We would have done much better to stay further away and spend a bit more on taxis. The hotel is over-priced for what and where it is and definitely NOT for tourists. The only reason you would want to stay there is if doing business in that neck of the woods and if you are, the Holiday Inn down the road which we noticed too late, must surely be a better bet. It would hard to be worse. To be fair, the buffet breakfast was not bad although 2 waitresses spent the entire time watching tv and never bothered to offer a second cup of coffee.

Reviews.Title: “A solid 4* experience”
Reviews.Author: Martinzz
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located for the airport and the western part of Mexico City, this hotel has all youÂ´d expect from a Radisson. The neighborhood is nothing to write home about with almost nonexistent eating options save a few local eateries, yet the hotel provides a free shuttle service to the nearest mall with a decent choice of restaurants. Rooms are OK, not overwhelming, but they do not lack anything. Some rooms are facing the hotel atrium, so they do not have an outside view - to be avoided or to be requested, at anyoneÂ´s convenience. The big plus of this hotel is its price-to-quality ratio which is very attractive.

Reviews.Title: “I Enjoyed My Stay”
Reviews.Author: Miguel-Mex
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at the Radisson Hotel Flamingos and was as good as the first time. My reservation was ready. Room service delivered my dinner in the range of time promised. The hotel has free WiFi which is a plus compared with the $10USD (minimum) that you have to pay for a period of 24 hrs. in other hotels. It is true that the hotel is not located in a nocturnal activity zone but if you hire a taxi it is very close to the Condesa (1.5mi), Polanco (3mi) or the "Pink Zone (2.5mi) centers of dining and night life. The only "problem" I had was that I requested a king-size bed and because of remodeling and refurbishing the kind of rooom I requested was not available.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service from a Brand Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rrakoczy
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the good. It is a cheap ($60 on Priceline), nice, clean and modern hotel located in a relativly central part of Mexico City. There is purified running water, strong showers and late-night room service. If you are looking for a comfortable and clean place to sleep, this will do fine. However, that is where it ends. The service at the hotel is terrible, leaning into the territory of absurd. For example, I called the front desk 6 times over a period of 4 hours asking for an extra pillow, which never came! The next day, when houskeeping took my TV remote control I had to ask - yes, this is true - no less than 10 times for a replacement remote. When I went down to the front desk for the final time he actually pulled a remote out from a drawer and gave it to me. Why he didn't do that hours ago, I have no idea. And my room service debacle isn't even worth mentioning. On the plus side, I did become fluent in Spanish when it comes pillows and remotes! The location of the hotel is ok, but not great. If you are driving it is near the highways and it doesn't take long to get to the airport, even in rush hour. However, it's a very grimy area that shuts down at night so you'll need to order room service in order to eat. Even the subway station is a 15 minute walk. There are many nicer hotels in Mexico City that are similiar in price, with better locations and service. So avoid this one if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: AntonioGuadalajara
Reviews.Content: My stay was so wonderful. Since my arrival, the staff was so helpul. An my room really nice decorated as I seen at photos. Food was delicious and personnel friendly. It was a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not your average Radisson...”
Reviews.Author: Farnham_Flyer
Reviews.Content: As a first trip to Mexico City, I didn't know any better... Colleagues were surprised we were booked in here - it has a reputation locally of hiring out rooms by the hour ! Also be very careful to use taxis approved by the hotel - although that is a general rule in Mexico City as per warnings given out by the US Embassy. On the upside, the rooms were well appointed with quality fittings and were spacious, if rather dated. Breakfasts were also good. However, I won't be staying here again - it does not deserve 4 star status.

Reviews.Title: “Fair for the price”
Reviews.Author: mack56
Reviews.Content: I booked online through priceline and got a great rate for this hotel $75USD. The check-in was very efficient and and although I stayed only one night every contact with the staff was positive. My room was generally clean although the toilet appeared to have not been thouroughly cleaned. The fixtures were moodern and in good working order. My room was on the first floor facing the street. The traffic was very noisey throughout the night and sound insolation was poor. If noise bothers you do not stay in a room facing the street! I was looking for a safe, clean hotel for one night as I was flying out the next day This hotel met those needs. There was a safe in the room for my camera and I was just able to fit my small laptop in there also. The area was not very convenient to the places that I wanted to see, Reforma and Zona Rosa, although the hotel hailed a cab for me and for about 95 pesos I was taken to Zona Rosa. I could not see that the surrounding area had any restaurants or stores within walking distance, although I did not ask or investigate thouroughly secondary to time restraints. Because of this I ate breakfast in the hotel which was fair, but failry expensive -- 140 pesos for a buffet. I personally would pay a bit more for a hotel in a different area if I were to return. I had no problem getting to the airport in about 40 minutes the next day and the fare was about 175 pesos.

Reviews.Title: “Give the Flamingos a chance”
Reviews.Author: tela08
Reviews.Content: I was very skeptical given the prior reviews. I must say, though, the staff was extremely helpful. Maybe they have been briefed in a meeting that they needed to kick up the service. Maybe they fired all those people and hired new ones. Whatever happened, it worked. The entire staff was entirely accomodating on whatever you may need. The location is not the best but there is a metro station about three blocks down that is very accessible. The buffet is great and has lots of choices! I would suggest including it in the room rate. I would definitely stay at this hotel again for my next stay in Mexico City.

Reviews.Title: “Wish there was a better hotel in neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: sagav
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel 3 times due to its convenient location. The hotel is modern and clean, but the staff is rude and incompetent. For 2 of our 3 stays, the reservations could not be found or were for a different price than we were given on the hotel's website and on our confirmation. For one stay, the hotel was prepaid and we had to pay a second time and work it out through the credit card company when we returned home. The front desk staff was put-off that they had to help us. Bell boys woke us at 1:30 am requesting money for bottled water (very suspicious) and another night at 4:30 am with a newspaper. Why are the bellboys knocking at doors in the middle of the night? We mentioned it to the front desk and they remarked that it must have been a mistake... two nights in a row!

Reviews.Title: “Should you book the Radisson Flamingos?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The answer would be.....Yes, only if you didnt find any other place to stay! Because, trust me, there has to be many other great places to stay in Mexico City, than this hotel. I had a talent competition on September 2004 with Intermodel 2004. The place where me and my group stayed at was this particular hotel. At one time, one of the workers was rude to me, just because i was asking him if he had seen my glasses around, since i had dropped them, and he was simply rude and ignored me. Another thing is that since i was from the States, they did not treat me like they would treat others that originated from Mexico. I belive it was unfair treatment. In other words, my stay there was not all that great.

HotelInfo.Name: Radisson Hotel Flamingos
HotelInfo.Address: Avda Revolucion 333 | Col. Tacubaya, Mexico City 11870, Mexico
